event.title: milled uranium at Chapman Valve in the late 1940s

data.event: The plant milled uranium at Chapman Valve in the late 1940s in a nuclear power project for the Brookhaven National Laboratory on Long Island, N.Y.
But the site also is likely to contain oils, asbestos and polychlorinated biphenyl, commonly known as PCB's, man-made organic chemicals banned in 1979, officials have said.

event.title: the discovery in the past few years

data.event: Another problem is the discovery in the past few years of a series of underground tunnels and pits, prompting questions about the strength of the foundation.

event.title: see that as likely in light of Gov. Deval L. Patrick in August

data.event: Officials see that as likely in light of Gov. Deval L. Patrick in August announcing a program to speed the cleanup of former industrial sites in the state, including the Chapman Valve property.
